subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: The nature of things!
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_02F7_01CA21AD.9E9F4FA0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Oh-to answer your first question-Solid proof for me would be an intelligent=
, back and forth conversation. It would also have to be VERY clear and many=
 people would have to say they hear the same thing.

  ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
  From: purplespacefriend 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent:=
 Thursday, August 20, 2009 3:35 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: The nature of t=
hings!


    So what constitutes proof? All I know for certain is that some=
thing talks by using the bits of audio from radio stations as the tunign is=
 swept. However, it can not be proven what it is that's talking, so I guess=
 that makes the whole thing invalid of little use. 

  Frank-S

  --- In EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
  >
  > "Just=
 because speech is all perception does not make invalid--that even normal s=
peech is highly subjective. If you used the rules of these scienctists, you=
 couldn't even trust what the guy sitting next to you was saying. You could=
n't trust what you were hearing!"
  > 
  > You're right....and I don't LOL!=
 All I hope to be able to do is find proof of actual spirit communication. =
I don't care so much about what is being communicated, only that it is.
  >=
 
  > ----------------------------------------------------------
  > 
  > 
=
  > "Even it was all imagination, that does not make it invalid or useless.=
 It's still serves as personal insight. "
  > 
  > I absolutely agree.
  > =

  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > From: purplespacefriend 
  > To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Thursday, August 20, 2009 7:55 AM
  > Subje=
ct: [EVP-ITC] Re: The nature of things!
  > 
  > 
  > I think the mind is n=
ot physical, and it's only these paranoid scientist types that try to bully=
 everyone into that extrememly narrow thinking that everything experienced =
is physical phenomenon only, and must be made to fit into that context. 
  =
> 
  > Just because speech is all perception does not make invalid--that ev=
en normal speech is highly subjective. If you used the rules of these scien=
ctists, you couldn't even trust what the guy sitting next to you was saying=
. You couldn't trust what you were hearing!
  > 
  > Perception is everythi=
ng. How is it that just before some mass death thing, like a plane crash or=
 some disaster I see the shadows shift, it should not be possible, but neve=
r the less, I've seen it happen over and over. These scientific types brain=
 wash everyone into not looking at clouds as you might imagine you see some=
thing--well a day or two before tornados in other states I see circles in t=
he clouds here-hundreds of miles away. People see me looking up and look at=
 me like I'm insane because of these bully skeptics. You're not allowed to =
perceive anything unless they tell you it's ok. You can't look at clouds, a=
nd you can't listen to voices fragments, cuz they can't explain away the pe=
rceptions. These scientist types are too brain dead to realize they too cre=
ate thier reality-all those supposed new particals did not exist before som=
eone theorized about them, then they are created and "discovered". 
  > 
  =
> Even it was all imagination, that does not make it invalid or useless. It=
's still serves as personal insight. 
  > 
  > frank-S
  > 
  > --- In EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@> wrote:
  > >
  > > Assumpt=
ions and expectations!? I hear a lot of both of these concepts in your word=
s and when mentioning your research. Cognitive functioning or processing se=
nsory information in order to come to a conclusion or judgement is how we f=
unction in this world. In order for your mind to understand this physical w=
orld you live in it automatically makes certain assumptions about sensory i=
nformation it takes in. Your eyes expect to see objects oriented correctly,=
 with the correct color, lighting, reflectivity and shading, and you expect=
 there size and shape to be within scale compared to other objects. My poin=
t is your senses have a range, which implies limitations. Since this is cor=
rect for your senses it is also correct for your ability to understand pers=
pectives with any wide ranging diversity. You are able to see and process t=
he information of our physical world just as any other human being does. Th=
at is great for a human but why would you think for a second,
  > > you cou=
ld understand the perspective of a mind and voice that speaks through a rad=
io from some unknown location.
  > > 
  > > The information you receive fro=
m the other side of your radios or even from thin air through EVP's could b=
e completely correct and true no matter what the context because you don't =
know what perspective it is coming from. You are making a lot of unfounded =
assumptions about the (dare I say) beings or worlds they exist in and have =
a lot of expectations about the information you receive. You are looking fo=
r answers to the wrong questions! Quit assuming that these entities know yo=
u or the people around you. Quit assuming they are here for your entertainm=
ent as a personal fortune teller. Quit expecting them to know answers to qu=
estion they may have themselves (just because they aren't physical doesn't =
mean they know everything). Don't assume you will be speaking to a dead rel=
ative or someone you once knew. Go to a fortune teller if you want informat=
ion about the furture. If you are serious about researching these voices an=
d the equipment used to record them
  > > then ask the right questions. 
  =
> > 
  > > If you have a box made by Frank then ask Frank how the different=
 circuits work, what is the puropose of some of the options, why is the RVG=
 better or worse than a circuit without it? You have a unique situation her=
e where the inventor of an important piece of equipment is willing to share=
 the most minute details of how it works without a price tag attached. Some=
 of the other box variations are sold by one person but created by someone =
else and usually based on some loose design similar to Frank's. The other e=
quipment made by Bill Chapp and others will probably stay a mystery because=
 they are sold for profit. Most people who use the different "hacks" know h=
ow to make them but don't know much about electronic theory or the behavior=
 of radio waves to understand how they work.
  > > 
  > > Point is you have=
 plenty of questions to ask the human's who have built the equipment you ar=
e using before you can even begin to ask questions of the entities you are =
communicating with.
  > > 
  > > Regards,
  > > 
  > > Frank R.
  > >
  >

=
